question.text: 1. What does HTML stand for?
question.answer: Hypertext Markup Language

question.text: 2. What is the purpose of HTML?
question.answer: To structure and present content on the web

question.text: 3. What are the basic HTML tags?
question.answer: <html>, <head>, <body>

question.text: 4. What is the difference between inline and block elements?
question.answer: Inline elements don't start on a new line, while block elements do

question.text: 5. What is the role of the <div> tag?
question.answer: To group and style elements together

question.text: 6. What is the purpose of the tag?
question.answer: To insert an image

question.text: 7. How do you create a hyperlink in HTML?
question.answer: Using the <a> tag with the href attribute

question.text: 8. What is the purpose of the <table> tag?
question.answer: To create a tabular data structure

question.text: 9. How do you add comments in HTML?
question.answer: Using the <!-- --> syntax

question.text: 10. What is the role of the <form> tag?
question.answer: To create an interactive input form

question.text: 11. How do you create a bullet list in HTML?
question.answer: Using the <ul> tag with <li> items

question.text: 12. What is the purpose of the <head> tag?
question.answer: To contain metadata about the HTML document

question.text: 13. How do you insert a line break in HTML?
question.answer:
Using the
tag

question.text: 14. What is the role of the <input> tag?
question.answer: To create input fields or buttons

question.text: 15. What does the alt attribute in the tag do?
question.answer: Provides alternative text for the image

question.text: 16. How do you set the background color of an HTML element?
question.answer: Using the background-color CSS property

question.text: 17. What is the purpose of the <span> tag?
question.answer: To apply styles to inline elements

question.text: 18. How do you create a numbered list in HTML?
question.answer: Using the <ol> tag with <li> items

question.text: 19. What is the role of the <meta> tag?
question.answer: To provide metadata about the HTML document

question.text: 20. How do you define a CSS stylesheet in HTML?
question.answer: Using the <link> tag with the rel and href attributes

question.text: 21. What are semantic elements in HTML5?
question.answer: Semantic elements provide meaning to the structure of a web page, such as <header>, <nav>, <article>, <section>, etc.

question.text: 22. What is the purpose of the canvas tag?
question.answer: The <canvas> tag is used to draw graphics, animations, and interactive elements using JavaScript.

question.text: 23. How do you embed a video in HTML?
question.answer: You can use the <video> tag along with the src attribute to specify the video source and include optional attributes such as controls and autoplay.

question.text: 24. What is the purpose of the <audio> tag?
question.answer: The <audio> tag is used to embed audio content on a webpage, allowing playback of audio files.

question.text: 25. How do you create a responsive design in HTML?
question.answer: You can use CSS media queries and fluid layouts to create responsive designs that adapt to different screen sizes and devices.

question.text: 26. What is the purpose of the iframe tag?
question.answer: The <iframe> tag is used to embed another HTML document within the current document. It is commonly used for embedding maps, videos, or other external content.

question.text: 27. How do you validate HTML code?
question.answer: HTML can be validated using online validation tools or through the use of HTML validation services and libraries.

question.text: 28. What are data attributes in HTML?
question.answer: Data attributes allow you to store custom data within HTML elements, which can be accessed and manipulated using JavaScript. They follow the data-* naming convention.

question.text: 29. How do you create a responsive image in HTML?
question.answer: You can use CSS techniques such as setting the max-width property to 100% to make an image responsive and adapt to the container's size.

question.text: 30. What is the purpose of the <progress> tag?
question.answer: The <progress> tag is used to represent the progress of a task or the completion percentage of an operation.

question.text: 31. What is the purpose of the <aside> tag?
question.answer: The <aside> tag is used to mark content that is tangentially related to the main content, such as sidebars or pull quotes.

question.text: 32. How do you include custom fonts in HTML?
question.answer: You can use the @font-face rule in CSS to include custom fonts by specifying the font file URL and assigning it a font family name.

question.text: 33. What is the purpose of the <details> and <summary> tags?
question.answer: The <details> and <summary> tags are used to create collapsible content sections, where the summary acts as a clickable header for the details.

question.text: 34. What is the role of the <output> tag?
question.answer: The <output> tag is used to display the result of a calculation or the output of a script.

question.text: 35. How do you create a sticky/fixed header in HTML?
question.answer: You can use CSS positioning and the position: fixed property to create a sticky header that remains fixed at the top of the page as the user scrolls.

question.text: 36. What is the purpose of the <meter> tag?
question.answer: The <meter> tag is used to represent a measurement within a predefined range, such as disk usage or battery level.

question.text: 37. What is the purpose of the <figure> and <figcaption> tags?
question.answer: The <figure> and <figcaption> tags are used to group and caption self-contained content, such as images, illustrations, or diagrams.

question.text: 38. What is the purpose of the <mark> tag?
question.answer: The <mark> tag is used to highlight or mark specific parts of text within a document.

question.text: 39. How do you create an accordion-style collapsible content in HTML?
question.answer: You can use JavaScript and CSS to create an accordion effect where clicking on a header expands or collapses its corresponding content section.

question.text: 40. What is the purpose of the <ruby> and <rt> tags?
question.answer: The <ruby> and <rt> tags are used for displaying annotations or pronunciation guides for East Asian languages.
